H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H123.def: = man; usually referred to as {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; brother of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>}; ► ancestor of the {L:Edomites<SDBH:אֲדֹומִי>}

H1224.def: = area enclosed by a stone wall or hedge made of branches and thorns, with a narrow opening which can be closed with brush or by the shepherd’s body; ► used for keeping sheep at night to protect them from thieves or wild animals

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H3830.def: = generic designation for any article of clothing

H1921.def: = action by which humans gives other humans a preferential treatment over other people

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H4069.def: = a reference to the cause, reason or purpose of an event; normally used in  questions with the purpose of identifying that cause, reason, or purpose; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that these things cannot be identified

H3830.def: = generic designation for any article of clothing

H122.def: = state in which an object is red or reddish in color

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H1869.def: = action by which humans or animals move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn

H1660.def: = basin ◄ hewn out of a rock or lined with plaster ► into which harvested grapes were thrown and trampled to squeeze out the juice, which from there flowed into a {L:trough or vat<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}; ≈ treading a winepress is often used as a figure of speech to refer to God's anger and punishment

H1869.def: = action by which humans or animals move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn

H6333.def: = basin; ◄ hewn out of a rock or lined with plaster ► into which harvested grapes were thrown and trampled to squeeze out the juice, which from there flowed into a trough or vat; ≈ treading a winepress is often used as a figure of speech to refer to God's anger and punishment

H905.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H7429.def: = action by which humans, deities, or animals tread heavily and noisily on people, plants, or objects; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H5332.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H5137.def: = process by which drops or small quantities of a liquid fall on object

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H4403.def: = generic designation for any article of clothing

H1351.def: = action by which humans who have been enslaved regain their freedom, which is normally achieved by paying a price

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5359.def: = action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5826.def: = process by which humans receive assistance or supported from other humans or deities

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H5564.def: = action by which humans put their hand(s) on another human, an animal, or an object ► often as a ritual before sacrifice or a sign of authority or punishment

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H947.def: = action by which humans move their arms and legs in an uncontrolled, haphazard fashion, like a young baby

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H5332.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1580.def: = causative process by which a mother causes her baby to become accustomed to food other than its mother's milk

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H2898.def: = state in which objects are of a high quality and/or a pleasure to look at

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H8266.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H6869.def: = a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape

H4397.def: = a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H160.def: = affection between people, or between people and deities

H2551.def: = process by which deities experience an emotion of having tender feelings towards someone, ► resulting in unwillingness to see that person come to harm

H5190.def: = causative action by which humans or forces take hold of objects and cause them to rise up from a certain location

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H4784.def: = action by which humans reject the authority of a ruler or deity to which they had formerly been subjected

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H2015.def: = action by which humans turn their body around in order to face a different direction than before

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H3898.def: = action by which humans ingest food

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

H346.def: = a reference to an unknown location; normally used with the purpose of finding out which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H3225.def: = the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun

H4872.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Amram<SDBH:עַמְרָם>} and {L:Jochebed<SDBH:יֹוכֶבֶד>}, younger brother of {L:Miriam<SDBH:מִרְיָם>} and {L:Aaron<SDBH:אַהֲרֹן>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► leader of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>} during exodus

H1234.def: = process by which an object is split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H8415.def: = great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H3782.def: = process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H1237.def: = a more or less flat and relatively low region, usually between uplands, hills or mountains, and following the course of a stream

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5117.def: = action by which humans or animals stop their current or regular activities, ► often with the purpose of recovering their strength

H5090.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to journey from one place to the other, whether with force or not

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H2073.def: = location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside; ≈ associated with high status

H346.def: = a reference to an unknown location; normally used with the purpose of finding out which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found

H7068.def: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger  for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

H1369.def: = the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H1995.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, sometimes associated with natural phenomena like heavy rain and the waves of a stormy sea

H4578.def: literally =  the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H662.def: = to restrain oneself from showing emotions

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H85.def: = man, also known as {L:Abram<SDBH:אַבְרָם>}; ◄ son of {L:Terah<SDBH:תֶּרַח>}; ► first patriarch of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}; father of {L:Ishmael<SDBH:יִשְׁמָעֵאל>} and {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H5234.def: = process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H7188.def: literally: to harden someone else's heart; = causative action by which deities cause humans to be stubborn and unwilling to yield

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3374.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H4705.def: = an object that is relatively small in size

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H947.def: = action by which humans move their arms and legs in an uncontrolled, haphazard fashion, like a young baby

H4720.def: = part of an object that is considered more holy than the rest

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H4910.def: = state in which humans are similar in shape, behavior or experience to others

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
